features: Best for Small Offices and Home Offices, the Brother HL-L3280CDW wireless compact digital color printer consistently produces impressive, laser-quality output on every page.
UPGRADE YOUR PROFESSIONAL DOCUMENTS. With the consistent dependability of laser-quality digital color printing.

MAXIMIZE EFFICIENCY WITH LASER FOCUSED FUNCTIONALITY. A compact, capable timesaver achieving print speeds up to 27 ppm.(1) With Automatic Duplex printing - the most efficient way to print double-sided pages.

RELIABLE RESULTS WITH BROTHER GENUINE TONER. When it’s time to replace your printer toner, be sure to choose Brother Genuine TN229 Standard Yield or TN229XL High Yield. And with Refresh EZ Print Subscription Service, you’ll never worry about running out of toner and you’ll enjoy savings of up to 50%(4) on Brother Genuine Toner. Get started with Refresh today with a Free Trial.(5) https://www.officedepot.com/l/brand/brotherrefresh

PRINT FROM CLOUD-BASED APPS. An integrated 2.7" touchscreen allows users to print from Cloud-based apps including Google Drive, Dropbox, EverNote, and others(6) commonly used by both businesses and entrepreneurs.
body.description: The Brother HL-L3280CDW wireless digital color printer is engineered to optimize efficiencies while working from home or in shared workspaces. Compact, capable, and reliable, this high-volume printer combines steady connectivity options with consistent performance, and premium laser-quality printing for smudge-free documents that position you for success. Always ready to get to work whenever you are, its print-forward features include speeds up to 27 pages per minute (ppm)(2), an intuitive 2.7” touchscreen, dual-band wireless(5) connectivity, and mobile device compatibility(6) for ease of use and ready accessibility. ENERGY STAR® compliant and EPEAT® Silver rated, the HL-L3280CDW is designed with eco-friendly printer features including Eco Mode, Toner Save Mode, and automatic duplex printing. For peace of mind printing, advanced security features safeguard sensitive information and create secure connections to devices and networks. Engineered and supported by Brother with a 1-year limited warranty and free online, call, or live chat support for the life of you printer, the HL-L3280CDW fits seamlessly into any small, busy workspace. 4. Disclaimers 1. Requires enrollment in a monthly billed Brother Refresh EZ Print Subscription service plan based on monthly printed page allotments. Unused pages roll over, limitations apply. Additional page set charges and taxes apply during trial. Plan, options offer, and pricing subject to change. Open to new subscribers located in the contiguous United States only. After the free trial period your credit card will be charged on a monthly basis for the Plan Fee, Overages, and Taxes in accordance with the Terms of Service. Overage fees will apply during free trial. Your service will continue on a month-to-month basis until you cancel it. May be canceled at any time. Upon cancellation, cartridge will be deactivated and must be replaced at users’ expense in order to continue printing. 2. Based on one-sided printing. Change from default setting required. 3. Maximum capacity based on using 20 lb. paper. 4. Requires an Internet connection and an account with desired service. 5. Requires connection to a wireless network. 6. Free app download and wireless connection required. Compatibility may vary based on device and operating system. 7. Based on monthly subscription cost in U.S. for Color Laser High Plan vs. average cost per page of eligible like standard capacity cartridges. Savings will vary based on Refresh EZ Print Subscription plan selected. Wi-Fi Direct is a registered trademark of Wi-Fi Alliance®. EPEAT is a trademark of the Green Electronics Council in the United States and other countries. ENERGY STAR and the ENERGY STAR mark are registered trademarks owned by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. Images are for illustrative purposes only. Specifications subject to change.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wireless Compact Digital Color Printer
reviews.reviewText: This print is so easy to setup and use. You can even print photos from your smart phone. The quality is great for the price. I have had about 5 Brother printers and they have always works very well with very little maintenance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars We love this thing
reviews.reviewText: Color laser printers get a bad rap as far as printing anything beyond simple graphics.With decent photo paper, I've gotta say, I'm really impressed with how well this prints photos, as well.Sure, it's not quite professional quality, like you can get with a good inkjet on photo paper. But it's WAY better than I expected, and really plenty good for the rare situations when we want a photo printed.And other color graphics/images look as fantastic as hoped/expected. Even on normal laser printer paper, you can print off nice color graphics for kid crafts or embellishing hobby projects, and they come out really nice.While it's true that most people don't NEED a color printer, it's been a more useful and fun luxury than we anticipated.And while the cost-per-page is going to technically be higher than say an ink tank inkjet printer, this is an overblown concern for many/most people. The (relatively small) difference in the cost of the printer itself might justifiably matter to some. But the cost of toner vs ink is only going to be significant if you are regularly printing a LOT.What matters more to me -- and I suspect many people -- is that (like any laser printer) this sucker NEVER DRIES OUT. You can go a month between printings if you want, and it doesn't matter! You don't get sideswiped by clogged nozzles when you just want to hop on really quick and print something. You don't have to go through cleaning cycles and spew out tons of ink and use up paper. You simply print stuff when you want to, and it just works.It starts printing pretty quickly, too, within 15 seconds or so for the first page. I don't know why I saw at least one other review claiming it took much longer than that.I'm glad it has an ethernet connection in addition to the WiFi option. And the little color touch screen, while not necessary really, is kinda handy sometimes.So far the toner economy has been phenomenal. Even the skimpy starter cartridges lasted way longer than I expected. Again, it all comes down to your print load. If you're pumping out hundreds of pages a day, yeah, you probably want to look elsewhere. For a typical home load, I maintain that this thing is amazing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Awesome brand, great printer, no problems whatsoever. I was looking to upgrade from my Hewlett Packard DeskJet printer that I absolutely detested. This purchase was like going from a golf cart to a Ferrari. The only thing that I had issues with was finding the MFC number. It said it was included with my printer's paperwork but it was nowhere to be found. I had to Google how to find it in the menu options. Obviously, that was really a minor thing. Highly recommend it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good printer marred by annoying vender software and “features”
reviews.reviewText: The printer itself is fine it prints quickly, and for a laser style printer. The output is fair. When printing pictures, the color is not saturated like the original. It’s all doll and flat even blacks show up that way, but that’s just part and parcel of the kind of printer it is.Setting up the printer was needlessly involved. Vendor software is just a shell to download more software, and all of it is designed to just install unneeded components. Got tired of jumping through hoops to just have the printer installed and deleted the vendor software which still hadn’t managed to actually setup the printer.Adding the printer to the wireless network wasn’t smooth either yet at first wouldn’t detect any wireless networks, and trying to enter a manually was a bust. Fortunately, attempting to set up the wireless network a second time it found the wireless network it was able to connect to the network. From there setting up the printer trivial just added printer. It was found automatically and configured automatically by the operating system.Through the entire unboxing and set up process the vendor constantly tries to get you to subscribe to a wasteful print supply agreement where you will always and unavoidably throw toner out. This appears to be brothers way of bringing the farce of inkjet printer supplies to laser, printers, and artificially increase the cost of printing, while simultaneously increasing waste, which is bad for the environment.This extends to the printer itself, which is designed to prevent you from actually using all of the toner and toner cartridge. I knew this going in and had verified that when the printer refuses to use more of the toner the block can be overridden. It’s annoying and has to be done every time for every toner cartridge. Not the end of world but an unnecessary annoyance.

reviews.reviewTitle: Likely the best budget friendly laser color with low cost of ownership
reviews.reviewText: Brother HLL3270CDW Wireless Color PrinterThis is one of the most cost effective color laser printer on the Amazon market. At the time of review it's a sub $400 ***laser**** color printer. !!!! I think the only one I can find on Amazon market that's a bit cheaper is one from Lexmark. I chose this because of the fact I can get third party color toner for a fraction of the cost of OEM. This tremendously reduces cost of ownership which is a huge deal when it comes to color toner. The Lexmark laser just didn't have as ubiquitous a market for third party toner replacement. I couldn't find any . So from longtrrm cost of ownership perspective, this Brother beats the Lexmark easily.This is a really large printer . You need a good amount of desk space to hold it. It is also fairly hefty with the weight. You need a good stable desktop to hold this up.Installing wifi or wired is preferred choice as it leads to easier placement and PC and laptop and phones can easily access it around the house. I chose and prefer wired connection for most reliable network access printing. For legacy, you still have the usb connector. Printing from your phone is a no brainer too. Download printer app on android (and apple) and it's so easy to reliably print a doc from your phone.The printer is ultra fast and quiet when printing. It has a low fan noise of course but from older laser printers I have including older brother lasers, this model seems to be significantly quieter when operating.Pages are crisppppppp. Text is sharpppppppp. Lines are smooth like pro print lab. Colors are vivid as well. It helps to have good paper quality ultra white 25 lb laser paper. Does it print photos? Sure... But don't expect photo I lnkjet quality prints. I have a Canon Pixma pro series for photo print which is far superior to this . But for quick photo prints for small draft work or kids school usage, it's ok.I'm really impressed with this . If you're looking for a daily printer that's easy to justify with your wallet that prints fast and crisp, and cost of ownership is really budget friendly for a color laser, this one is easy to recommend.
No es la intensidad de color que yo esperaba pero funciona.. y está súper fácil destrabar las hojas… la compré pensando que era doble carta y error!!! Es oficio pero bueno usémosla!
Excelente impresora, llegó en muy buen estado y el tiempo estimado. Acepta hojas de gramaje hasta de 250 por la bandeja manual.

I was impressed with how well this printer was packaged when it was shipped to me. This Brother color laser printer works very well for me and it has some features I did not have in color laser printers in the past. I am very pleased with the purchase of this laser color printer.
Worked right out of the box, no laborious alignment setup required, produced high quality output from the very first page.
